author: Author
compress_keyframe_interval_desc: Insert an I-Frame (full snapshot) every N frames. More I-Frames = larger file but faster seeking. (0 = every frame is an I-Frame)
compress_warning: If you don't understand what this does, please do not use it.
compress_zstd_level_desc: Higher level = better compression ratio but slower encoding. Range: 1-5.
edit_compress_desc: Re-encode the NBL file using I/P frame compression to reduce file size. I-Frames store full particle snapshots; P-Frames store only deltas from the previous frame, significantly reducing redundancy.
edit_particle_size_desc: Adjust the size of all particles in the animation
edit_transform_desc: Apply spatial transformations to the entire animation
edit_trim_desc: Extract a sub-range of frames from the animation
expr_funcs_desc: sin, cos, tan, abs, random, pow, sqrt, lerp, clamp... (Use ; to separate statements)
expr_vars_desc: x, y, z (pos), vx, vy (vel), id (particle index), cr, cg, cb (color), alpha, mpsize (size), t (current tick)
pex_confirm_delete_msg: Are you sure you want to delete this command?
pex_help_commands_val:
normal: Basic spawning
conditional: Spawning with conditional range
parameter: Control movement with expressions (Recommended)
polar-parameter: Control with polar coordinates
tick-parameter: Parameters changing over time
pex_help_math_val:
Basic: sin, cos, tan, pow, sqrt, abs, min, max, random, lerp, clamp
Advanced: floorDiv, floorMod, fma (Fused Multiply-Add), multiplyHigh, addExact, etc.
pex_help_vars_val:
x, y, z: Position relative to center
vx, vy, vz: Current velocity
cr, cg, cb: Color (0-255)
alpha: Transparency (0.0-1.0)
mpsize: Particle size
age, t: Lifetime in ticks
dis: Accumulated distance
destroy: Set to 1 to remove particle
size_mode_scale_desc: Multiply all particle sizes by a given factor.
size_mode_uniform_desc: Set all particle sizes to a fixed value.
speed_mode_both_desc: Change target FPS and interpolate frame data simultaneously.
speed_mode_fps_only_desc: Directly change the target FPS without modifying frame data.
speed_mode_interp_desc: Keep current FPS, add/remove frames via linear interpolation.
